<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART I</font></b></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">This Report contains certain statements of a
forward-looking nature relating to future events or the future performance of
our company.&#160; Words such as &#147;expects,&#148;
&#147;anticipates,&#148; &#147;intends,&#148; &#147;plans,&#148; &#147;believes,&#148; &#147;seeks,&#148; &#147;estimates&#148; and similar
expressions or variations of such words are intended to identify
forward-looking statements, but are not the only means of identifying
forward-looking statements.&#160; Prospective
investors are cautioned that such statements are only predictions and that
actual events or results may differ materially.&#160;
In evaluating such statements, prospective investors should specifically
consider various factors identified in this Report, including the matters set
forth below under the caption &#147;Risk Factors,&#148; which could cause actual results
to differ materially from those indicated by such forward-looking statements.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 1.&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Business</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Overland was originally founded and
incorporated as Overland Data, Inc. in California in 1980.&#160; In June&nbsp;2002 we changed our name to
Overland Storage, Inc.&#160; Our principal
executive offices are located at 4820&nbsp;Overland Avenue, San Diego,
California 92123, telephone 858-571-5555.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For over 20 years, we have delivered data
interchange and protection solutions designed for backup and recovery to ensure
business continuity.&#160; Historically, we
have focused on delivering a portfolio of automation solutions including tape
loader and library systems designed for small business and midrange computing
environments.&#160; Beginning with the June
2003 acquisition of Okapi Software, Inc., a privately-owned company based in
San Diego, California, we expanded our product offerings to include a family of
intelligent disk-based appliances to complement our tape solutions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One of the main market differentiators of our
products is that we design them around a modular, scalable architecture.&#160; This enables customers to purchase storage as
they need it, rather than having to purchase a larger monolithic device with
excess capacity.&#160; Customers can purchase
an initial module to meet their near-term needs, and later increase speed and
capacity by adding modules that can be interconnected to function as a single
system.&#160; This provides a lower price
entry point, investment protection, and an increased level of fault tolerance,
as each module is self-sufficient and will continue to function even if another
were to fail.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also differentiate ourselves with our
&#147;go-to-market&#148; approach.&#160; We are the only
supplier in our market space that has a completely indirect sales model.&#160; We do not have a direct sales force.&#160; Approximately 65% of our sales are generated
through private label arrangements with original equipment manufacturers
(OEMs).&#160; The remainder of our sales are
made through commercial distributors, catalogers and value-added resellers
(VARs).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">End-users of our products include small and
midsize businesses, as well as divisions and operating units of large
multi-national corporations, governmental organizations, universities and other
non-profit institutions.&#160; Our products
are used in a broad range of industry sectors including financial services,
healthcare, retail, manufacturing, telecommunications, broadcasting, research
and development and many others.&#160; Our
products are sold world-wide in the Americas, EMEA (Europe, Middle East,
Africa) and Asia Pacific.&#160; Approximately
49% of our revenues are generated internationally, primarily in Europe.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Internet address is www.overlandstorage.com.&#160; We make available free of charge on our
Internet website our annual report on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form
10-Q, current reports on Form 8-K, and amendments to those reports filed pursuant
to Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act as soon as
reasonably practicable after we electronically file such material with, or
furnish it to, the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160; The contents of our website are not a part of
this Report.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
Direction and Strategy</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our strategy is to be the market leader in
mid-range data protection solutions for backup and recovery.&#160; We intend to leverage our current position as
the leader in mid-range tape automation into a similar leadership position in
intelligent disk-based backup and recovery appliances.&#160; This is a relatively new market space that we
believe has great promise and can significantly expand our total addressable
market.&#160; Because tape is the only
reliable, &#147;removable&#148;, high capacity storage</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">media, it is our belief that specialized
disk-based appliances should generally be complementary to the tape automation
market for some time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The advent of low-cost serial ATA disk and
iSCSI network technology, greatly increased regulatory compliance, and the
continued growth of digital data are all factors that are driving businesses to
consider the use of secondary storage and disk-based appliances.&#160; Tape backup is the mainstay of any company&#146;s
data protection strategy, but it is time consuming and often unreliable and
inefficient.&#160; Furthermore, the process of
recovering data from tape is equally time consuming and inefficient.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Companies are realizing that 75% of data that
needs to be recovered is new, having been accessed or created within the last
72 hours.&#160; Studies show that
approximately 90% of recovered data is two weeks old, or last accessed within
that period.&#160; As a result, many IT
managers are electing to use disk-based appliances as an intermediate staging
area, with the backup data eventually moving to tape.&#160; The use of these devices can significantly
accelerate both backups and restores.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Success in the disk-based appliance market
will require us to introduce a steady stream of new products that are
feature-rich and competitively priced.&#160;
In order to accomplish this, we must significantly enhance our software
development team and commit additional sales and marketing resources to promote
and sell the products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We must also maintain our leadership position
in tape automation.&#160; This will require us
to keep our product offerings fresh and competitively priced.&#160; We believe there will be further
consolidation in the marketplace, and we are aggressively pursuing a number of
new OEM opportunities to increase business with existing customers and gain new
ones.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Products</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our automation solution and other products include:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#149;</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Libraries</font></i> - Automated tape libraries are devices capable of
managing multiple data cartridges and incorporate two or more tape drives to
provide unattended backup of large quantities of data.&#160; Our Libraries incorporate tape drives
supplied by other manufacturers based on the leading mid-range tape
technologies, including LTO (Linear Tape Open), DLTtape and AIT (Advanced
Intelligent Tape).&#160; We currently offer
the following library products:</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Scalable NEO SERIES<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b></font></i> &#150;
We offer 3 versions of our NEO product family:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>NEO 2000 can accommodate up to 2 tape drives
and 30 cartridges and can scale up to 8 modules high with 16 tape drives and
240 cartridges.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>NEO 4000 can accommodate up to 4 tape drives
and 60 cartridges and can scale up to 4 modules high to comprise a system of 16
tape drives and 240 cartridges.&#160;
Customers can configure NEO systems with a combination of NEO 2000 and
4000 modules.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>NEO 8000, introduced in December&nbsp;2003,
is our newest tape library.&#160;&#160; It consists
of a base model with 100-cartridge capacity which can be scaled up to
500 cartridges through a field-enabled software key.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">PowerLoaders</font></i><b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;"> and Loaders</font></i> &#150; Made for smaller environments that do not
require scalability, we offer both power loaders with one or two tape drives,
and loaders with only a single tape drive.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#149;</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Disk-based Products</font></i> &#150; In August&nbsp;2003 we began shipping
our REO SERIES<sup>TM</sup> of disk-based products based on the technology we
received in the Okapi Software acquisition.&#160;
The REO product family currently consists of two products: (1) the REO
4000<sup>TM</sup> with 8 disk drives and a native capacity of 2 terabytes; and
(2) the REO 1000<sup>TM</sup> with 4 disk drives and a native capacity of 1
terabyte.&#160; A larger and higher capacity
version of REO is scheduled for introduction in September&nbsp;2004.&#160; The strength of these intelligent appliances
lies in the embedded software.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#149;</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Related Products and Services</font></i>&#150; We have a variety of products
and services supporting our Libraries, PowerLoaders and Loaders.&#160; We currently offer the following additional
products and services:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Desktop and
internal upgrade tape drives.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Spares and post
warranty return-to-factory and on-site service.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Media, including
tape cartridges for DLT, SDLT, AIT and LTO formats.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#149;</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">VR<sup>2</sup></font></i><b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>(Variable Rate Randomizer) &#150; VR<sup>2</sup><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>is our patented data<sup>  </sup>encoding technology.&#160; This technology, which is embedded in an
Applications Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) chip, is capable of
significantly increasing the native capacity and data transfer rate performance
of linear tape technologies without requiring any changes in tape path design,
recording heads and/or media.&#160; This
performance is accomplished by achieving encoding efficiency of greater than
99%.&#160; We have licensed VR<sup>2 </sup>to
Tandberg Data ASA for use in its Scalable Linear Recording (SLR) tape drives,
to Imation Corporation as the owner of the Travan technology format, to
Certance, formerly Seagate, for use in its Travan tape drive offerings, to
Storage Technology Corporation (StorageTek) for use in its T9940 and T9840
drives and future tape drive products, and to Quantum.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Customers</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating structure is optimized for our
mid-range strategy in that our products do not require us to have a &#147;direct&#148;
(to end-users) sales or service force.&#160;
We sell all our products on an indirect basis, primarily through three
channels or types of customers: (i) OEMs; (ii) distributors; and (iii)
VARs.&#160; Regardless of the channel through
which they are sold, all of our products are designed and manufactured to meet
OEM-level requirements and reliability standards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#149;</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">OEM Channel</font></i></b> - Our current
significant OEM supply agreements are with Hewlett Packard Company (HP) and
International Business Machine Corporation (IBM), both of which incorporate our
NEO products into their system offerings.&#160;
Fujitsu and NEC also purchase NEO products and sell them under their
respective labels.&#160; However, we are
required to sell to them through their appointed reseller, and consequently we
classify them as VAR customers rather than OEM customers.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although we continually strive to win new OEM business, the OEM sales
cycle is often lengthy and uncertain.&#160; It
typically consists of a general technology evaluation, qualification of product
specifications, verification of product performance against these
specifications, integration testing of the product within the customers&#146;
systems, product announcement and volume shipment.&#160; As is customary in the industry, our OEM
contracts have a three year term, provide for periodic price reviews and the
customers are not required to purchase minimum quantities.&#160; Our existing contracts with HP (dated
August&nbsp;2003) and IBM (dated November&nbsp;2002) also provide that title to
inventory shipped from our warehouse into various inventory hub locations
remains with us until the products are shipped to their customers.&#160; HP, including the former Compaq that HP
acquired in May 2002, has been our largest customer, accounting for approximately
59%, 58%, and 62% of sales in fiscal years 2004, 2003, and 2002,
respectively.&#160; No other customer
accounted for more than 10% of sales in any year during the three-year period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#149;</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Distribution Channel</font></i></b> - Our primary
distribution customers include Ingram Micro, Inc., Tech Data Corporation and
Bell Microproducts, Inc. in the United States and approximately 8 technical
distributors in Europe.&#160; Typically, these
distributors sell our products to smaller VARs and catalogers who in turn sell
to end-users.&#160; The distribution
agreements include provisions for rights of return, stock rotation and price
protection, common terms in the commercial distribution area.&#160; Because of these terms, revenue from
shipments to these customers is not recognized until the related products are
in turn sold by the distributor.&#160; We
support these distributors through a dedicated field sales force and provide
further support through field sales personnel who work with the smaller VARs
and catalogers to generate end-user sales and create the pull through its
distribution customers.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#149;</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">VAR Channel</font></i></b> - Our VAR channel
includes systems integrators and larger VARs who qualify to purchase direct
from Overland.&#160; Some of these customers
specialize in the insurance, banking, financial, geophysical or medical
industries, and offer a variety of value-added services relating to our
products.&#160; Our products frequently are
packaged by these customers as part of a complete data processing system or
combined with other storage devices, such as redundant array of independent
disks (RAID) systems, to deliver a complete storage subsystem.&#160; These customers also recommend our products
as replacement solutions when backup systems are upgraded, and bundle our
products with storage management software specific to the end-user&#146;s
system.&#160; We support this channel through
our field sales representatives.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our products are sold both domestically and
internationally and we have sales personnel located in various cities
throughout the world.&#160; We divide our
sales into three geographical regions: (1)&nbsp;the Americas, consisting of
North and South America; (2) Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA); and (3)
Asia Pacific (APAC).&#160; Primary support for
customers in the Americas is provided from our San Diego headquarters office.&#160; EMEA is supported by our wholly-owned
subsidiaries located in Wokingham, England; Paris, France; and Munich,
Germany.&#160; The subsidiary in England
provides sales, technical support and repair services, while the subsidiaries
in France and Germany provide sales and technical support.&#160; Our APAC customers are supported by our sales
office in Singapore.&#160; We assign to our
international distributors the right to sell our products in a</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">country or group of countries.&#160;
In addition, many domestic customers ship a portion of our products to
their overseas customers.&#160; Our foreign
sales for fiscal years 2004, 2003 and 2002 were approximately $116.5 million,
$85.1 million and $77.1 million, respectively, representing 49%, 43% and 47%,
respectively, of our total net revenues.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our marketing efforts include
support for both our OEM and branded customers.&#160;
Our branded channel partners are provided with a full range of marketing
materials, including product specification literature, software connectivity
information and application notes.&#160; Our
sales management and engineering personnel provide support to the channel
partners and, in certain instances, visit potential customer sites to explain
and demonstrate the technical advantages of our products.&#160; We maintain press relations both domestically
and in Europe, and participate in national and regional trade shows in varying
degrees both domestically and internationally.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales to customers
outside of the U.S. represent a significant portion of our sales.&#160; International sales are subject to various
risks and uncertainties.&#160; See &#147;Our
international operations are important to our business and involve unique
risks&#148; in Risk Factors below.&#160; Sales
generated by our European channel generally show seasonal slowing during our
first fiscal quarter (July&nbsp;through September), reflecting the summer
holiday period in Europe.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Customer Service and Support</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our technical support personnel are trained on our products and assist
customers with &#147;plug-and-play&#148; compatibility between multiple hardware
platforms, operating systems and backup, data interchange and storage
management software.&#160; Our application
engineers are available to solve more complex customer problems and visit
customer sites when necessary.&#160; Customers
that need service and support can contact us through our toll-free telephone
lines, facsimile and Internet e-mail.&#160;
Application notes and user manuals can be obtained directly from our
website.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We generally provide a three year advance replacement return-to-factory
warranty on our NEO SERIES, PowerLoader<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b> and
LoaderXpress<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b> products.&#160; We also provide on-site service for the first
warranty year of the NEO SERIES products for which we contract with third-party
service providers.&#160; For most products, we
offer a program called XchangeNOW<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#174;</font></b> as part of
our return-to-factory warranty that enables customers to receive an advance
replacement unit shipped within two business days after placing a service
request.&#160; Separately priced on-site
warranties are offered for sale to customers of other product lines.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Research and Development</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We incurred research and development
(R&amp;D) costs of $7.3 million, $7.4 million and $6.6 million in fiscal years
2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively, representing 3.0%, 3.8% and 4.0% of net
revenues, respectively.&#160; We currently
employ 43 people in our R&amp;D department, including electrical, mechanical
and firmware engineers who support our tape automation business and software
engineers who support our REO disk-based appliance products.&#160; In fiscal year 2005 we intend to
significantly expand our REO software development team as we work to deliver a
steady stream of new products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our level of R&amp;D spending is somewhat
dependent upon our product development cycles.&#160;
During the later stages of the cycles, including the building of alpha
and beta units and design verification testing, significant amounts of
development materials are consumed.&#160; OEM
customers also generally require evaluation units to qualify a new design.&#160; We anticipate that our move into disk-based
appliances will require a higher level of R&amp;D spending in order for us to
be competitive and successful in this new market.&#160; Despite our R&amp;D efforts, we may not be
able to identify, develop, manufacture, market or support new or enhanced
products successfully or on a timely basis and any new products may not gain
market acceptance.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Manufacturing
and Suppliers</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We maintain a fully integrated factory in San Diego,
California that is ISO 9001 certified.&#160;
Major OEM customers have also certified all of our production lines and
manufacturing processes.&#160; We perform
product assembly, integration and testing, while leaving component and
piece-part manufacturing to our supplier partners.&#160; Our products have a large number of
components and subassemblies produced by outside suppliers.&#160; We depend greatly on these suppliers for tape
drives, printed circuit boards and integrated circuits, which are essential to
the manufacture of our products.&#160; We work
closely with a group of regional, national and international suppliers, which
are carefully selected based on their ability to provide quality parts and
components that meet our specifications, as well as meet present and future
volume requirements.&#160; For certain items,
we qualify only a single source, which can magnify the risk of shortages and
decrease our ability to negotiate with our suppliers on the basis of
price.&#160; From time to time in the past, we have not
obtained as many drives as we have needed from various vendors due to drive
shortages or quality issues.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, Overland branded products are not
manufactured until an order is received.&#160;
The typical lead-time for manufacturing products is three days and
backlog is not a significant factor to our business.&#160; Our two largest OEM customers, HP and IBM,
both require that we maintain inventory on hand, known as buffer stock, at any
given time sufficient to supply their forecasted requirements for the next
three weeks.&#160; They provide weekly
forecast information that allows us to manage both raw material and finished
goods inventories.&#160; The buffer stock is
shipped into various distribution hubs around the world and we retain ownership
of that inventory until it is pulled by HP and IBM to fulfill customer orders,
at which time we record the sale.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We occupied our new headquarters and manufacturing
buildings in March&nbsp;2002.&#160; The
buildings are subject to a 12-year lease with one five-year extension option.
We believe that we have the capacity to support unit production levels several
times greater than our current rate of production.&#160; We maintain approximately 30% of our direct
labor in the form of temporary staffing to accommodate normal business
fluctuations and control our staffing levels carefully to meet customer
requirements at any specific time.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Competition</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The worldwide storage market is intensely
competitive and barriers to entry are relatively low.&#160; Our competitors vary in size for small
start-ups to large multi-national corporations who have substantially greater
financial, R&amp;D and marketing resources.&#160;
In the tape automation market, our primary competition includes Advanced
Digital Information Corporation, Quantum Corporation and Storage Technology
Corporation.<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">  </font></b>&#160;Key competitive factors include product
features, reliability, durability, scalability and price.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our disk-based products currently compete
with products made by Quantum Corporation, Advanced Digital Information
Corporation, Storage Technology Corporation, EMC Corporation, Network
Appliance, Inc. and numerous small startups.&#160;
We believe additional competitors are likely to enter the market.&#160;&#160; Key competitive factors in these markets
include performance, functionality, scalability, availability,
interoperability, connectivity, time to market enhancements and total value of
ownership.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The markets for all of our products are
characterized by significant price competition, and we anticipate that our
products will face increasing price pressure.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Proprietary Rights</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General&#160; &#150; </font></b><font style="font-weight:normal;">In the tape automation space, we believe that
patent, copyright, trademark and trade secret protection are less significant
than factors such as the knowledge, ability and experience of our personnel,
new product introductions and product enhancements.&#160; In the disk-based appliance space, we believe
intellectual property protection will be an important competitive advantage,
and we intend to secure a significant number of patents, copyrights and
trademarks as quickly as possible to obtain and protect our leadership
position.&#160;&#160; We presently hold 16</font>  <font style="font-weight:normal;">United</font><font style="font-weight:normal;"> States patents and have </font><font style="font-weight:normal;">2</font>  <font style="font-weight:normal;">United States patents pending. In general, these patents have a 20-year
term from the first effective filing date for each patent. We also hold a
number of foreign patents and patent applications for certain of our products
and technologies.&#160; These</font><font style="font-weight:normal;"> rights, however, may not prevent competitors from
developing substantially equivalent or superior products to ours.&#160; In addition, our present and future patents
may be challenged, invalidated or circumvented, reducing or eliminating our
proprietary protection.</font></h4>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">VR<sup>2</sup> Technology</font></b>
&#150; We have entered into various intellectual property licensing agreements
relating to our VR<sup>2</sup> technology.&#160;
These agreements require the payment of royalty fees based on sales by
licensees of products containing VR<sup>2</sup>.&#160; In certain instances, we sell to the licensee
ASIC chips embodying VR<sup>2 </sup>priced to include the cost of the chip plus
an embedded royalty fee.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employees</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of June&nbsp;30, 2004 we had 371 employees, including 112 in sales
and marketing, 43 in research and development, 168 in manufacturing and
operations and 48 in finance, information systems, human resources and other
management.&#160; There are no collective
bargaining contracts covering any of the employees and we believe that our
relationship with our employees is good.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RISK FACTORS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">An investment in our
company involves a high degree of risk.&#160;
In addition to the other information included in this Report, you should
carefully consider the following risk factors in evaluating an investment in
our company.&#160; You should consider these
matters in conjunction with the other information included or incorporated by
reference in this Report.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our
business is highly dependent on our level of sales to one major customer</font></b><i><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;">.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hewlett
Packard, including the former Compaq which HP acquired in May 2002, has been
our largest customer accounting for approximately 59% of net revenues in fiscal
year 2004, 58% of net revenues in fiscal year 2003 and 62% of net revenues in
fiscal year 2002.&#160; No other customer
accounted for more than 10% of net revenues during the year ended June&nbsp;30,
2004.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our sales
to HP may be affected adversely by various factors relating to HP&#146;s business,
liquidity, results of operation and financial position.&#160; We expect that HP will continue to represent
a significant portion of our revenues in future periods.&#160; Consequently, our business, liquidity,
results of operation and financial position would be materially and adversely
affected by the loss of the HP account, or the reduction, delay or cancellation
of HP orders.&#160; Neither HP nor any other
customer is obligated to purchase a specific amount of our products or provide
binding forecasts of purchases for any period.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The market price of our common
stock may be volatile</font></b><i><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;">.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The market price of our common stock has
experienced significant fluctuations since it commenced trading in February
1997.&#160; The market price of our common stock
may continue to fluctuate significantly in the future.&#160; Many factors could cause the market price of
our common stock to fluctuate, including:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">announcements concerning us, our competitors, our customers or our
industry;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in earnings estimates by analysts;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">purchasing decisions of HP and other significant customers;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">quarterly variations in operating results;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the introduction of new technologies or products;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in product pricing policies by us or our competitors; and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in general economic conditions.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, stock markets have experienced
extreme price and volume volatility in recent years.&#160; This volatility has had a substantial effect
on the market prices of securities of many smaller public companies for reasons
frequently unrelated or disproportionate to the operating performance of the
specific companies.&#160; These market
fluctuations may adversely affect the market price of our common stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our
financial results may fluctuate substantially for many reasons, and past
results should not be relied on as indications of future performance.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All of the markets that we serve are volatile
and subject to market shifts, which we may not be able to discern in advance. A
slowdown in the demand for workstations, mid-range computer systems, networks
and servers could have a significant adverse effect on the demand for our
products in any given period.&#160; We have
experienced delays in receipt of purchase orders and, on occasion, anticipated
purchase orders have been rescheduled or have not materialized due to changes
in customer requirements.&#160; Our customers
may cancel or delay purchase orders for a variety of reasons, including the
rescheduling of new product introductions, changes in their inventory practices
or forecasted demand, general economic conditions affecting our customers&#146;
markets, changes in our pricing or the pricing of our competitors, new product
announcements by us or others, quality or reliability problems related to our
products or selection of competitive products as alternate sources of
supply.&#160; In particular, our ability to
forecast sales to distributors, integrators and value-added resellers is
especially limited as these customers typically provide to us relatively short
order lead times or are permitted to change orders on short notice.&#160; Given that a large portion of our sales are
generated by our European channel, our first fiscal quarter (July through
September) is commonly impacted by seasonally slow European orders, reflecting
the summer holiday period in Europe.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, our financial results have fluctuated and will continue to fluctuate
quarterly and annually based on many other factors such as:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in customer mix (e.g., OEM vs. branded);</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the level of utilization of our production capacity;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in product mix;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">fluctuations in average selling prices;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">currency exchange fluctuations;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">manufacturing yields;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">increases in production and engineering costs associated with initial
production of new products;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">increases in the cost of or limitations on availability of materials;
and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">labor shortages.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on all of the foregoing, we believe
that our revenues and operating results will continue to fluctuate, and
period-to-period comparisons are not necessarily meaningful and should not be
relied on as indications of future performance.&#160;
Furthermore, in some future quarters, our revenues and operating results
could be below the expectations of public market analysts or investors, which
could result in a material adverse effect on the price of our common
stock.&#160; In addition, portions of our
expenses are fixed and difficult to reduce if revenues do not meet our
expectations.&#160; These fixed expenses
magnify the material adverse effect of any revenue shortfall.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">We face
intense competition and price pressure, and many of our competitors have
substantially greater resources than we do.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The worldwide storage market is intensely
competitive as a number of manufacturers of tape automation solutions and
storage management software products compete for a limited number of
customers.&#160; In addition, barriers to
entry are relatively low in these markets.&#160;
We currently participate in the mid-range of the tape backup
market.&#160; In this segment, some of our
competitors have substantially greater financial and other resources, larger
research and development staffs, and more experience and capabilities in
manufacturing, marketing and distributing products.&#160; Our hardware products currently compete with products
made by Advanced Digital Information Corporation, Quantum Corporation and
Storage Technology Corporation.&#160; Our
disk-based products currently compete with products made by International
Business Machines Corporation, HP, Computer Associates International, Inc., EMC
Corporation, Veritas Software Corporation, Quantum Corporation, Network
Appliance, Inc. and numerous small startups.&#160;
The markets for our products are characterized by significant price
competition, and we anticipate that our products will face increasing price
pressure.&#160; This pressure could result in
significant price erosion, reduced profit margins and loss of market share, any
of which could have a material adverse effect on our business, liquidity,
results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our
business is highly dependent on the continued availability and market
acceptance of the tape technologies incorporated in our products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We derive a majority of our revenue from
products that incorporate tape drives purchased from other manufacturers and
based on unique formats and tape technologies.&#160;
Certain of these tape drives are only available from a single
manufacturer, and we expect to continue to derive a substantial amount of our
revenue from products incorporating these tape drives for the foreseeable
future.&#160; In particular, a portion of our
products incorporate DLTtape drives manufactured by Quantum Corporation.&#160; Quantum also is one of our competitors because
Quantum markets its own tape automation products.&#160; We do not have a long-term contract with
Quantum, which could cease supplying tape drives directly to us.&#160; Although Quantum has licensed Tandberg Data
to be a second source manufacturer of DLTtape drives, we have not qualified
Tandberg as an alternative supplier.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, from time to time in the past,
we have not obtained as many drives as we have needed from various vendors due
to drive shortages or quality issues.&#160;
Any prolonged inability to obtain adequate deliveries could require us
to pay more for components, parts and other supplies, seek alternative sources
of supply, delay shipment of products and damage relationships with current and
prospective customers.&#160; This type of
delay or damage could have a material adverse effect on</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>

<div style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="red" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183379\10378-1-ba.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:47 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial
position.&#160; In fiscal year 1997, we
experienced problems with the supply of a newly-introduced tape drive and these
problems materially adversely affected our sales and earnings for that year.&#160; We cannot assure you that these or similar
problems will not reoccur, or that we will not experience similar or more
serious disruptions in supply in the future with current or new versions of
tape drives.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our future operating results depend on the
continued availability and market acceptance of the current tape technologies
that we use.&#160; If tape drives
incorporating other technologies gain comparable or superior market acceptance
than those currently incorporated in our products, then we might have to modify
the design of our tape automation products to incorporate these tape
drives.&#160; Our inability to do so or to
obtain sufficient quantities of these tape drives could have a material adverse
effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our tape-based storage solutions compete with
other storage technologies, such as hard disk drives, and may face competition
in the future from other emerging technologies. The prices of hard disk drives
continue to decrease while capacity and performance have increased. If hard
disk drives or products incorporating other technologies gain comparable or
superior market acceptance to tape drive technology, or their costs decline far
more rapidly than tape drive and media costs, we would face increased
competition from these alternative technologies. If we are not able to respond
to such competition through increased performance and lower prices for our
products, or the introduction of competitive new products incorporating new
technologies, our business, financial condition and operating results could be
materially and adversely affected.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our
success depends on our ability to anticipate rapid technological changes and
develop new and enhanced products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As an advanced technology company, we are
subject to numerous risks and uncertainties, generally characterized by rapid
technological change and intense competition.&#160;
In this environment, our future success will depend on our ability to
anticipate changes in technology, to develop new and enhanced products on a
timely and cost-effective basis and to introduce, manufacture and achieve
market acceptance of these new and enhanced products.&#160; Development schedules for high technology
products are inherently subject to uncertainty.&#160;
We may not meet our product development schedules, including those for
products based on our disk-based technology, and development costs could exceed
budgeted amounts.&#160; In addition, there can
be no assurance that the licensees of our VR2 technology will meet their product
development schedules.&#160; Our business,
liquidity, results of operation and financial position may be materially and
adversely affected if the products or product enhancements that we develop are
delayed or not delivered due to developmental problems, quality issues or
component shortage problems, or if our products or product enhancements do not
achieve market acceptance or are unreliable.&#160;
The introduction, whether by us or our competitors, of new products
embodying new technologies, such as new sequential or random access mass
storage devices, and the emergence of new industry standards could render
existing products obsolete or not marketable, which may have a material adverse
effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">We rely on outside suppliers to
provide a large number of components and subassemblies incorporated in our
products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our products have a large number of
