<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">OVERLAND
STORAGE, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="NotesToConsolidatedFinancialStatemen"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></a></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 1 - OPERATIONS AND SUMMARY
OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">General</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Overland Storage, Inc.
(the &#147;Company&#148;) was incorporated on September&nbsp;8, 1980 under the laws of
the State of California.&#160; The Company
designs, develops, manufactures, markets and supports automated tape and disk-based
data storage systems used by businesses for backup, archival and data
interchange functions in environments from small businesses to large
enterprises requiring high-availability networks. The Company&#146;s fiscal year
ends on the Sunday closest to June&nbsp;30.&#160;
For ease of presentation, the Company&#146;s year-end is deemed to be
June&nbsp;30.&#160; Fiscal years 2004, 2003
and 2002 each included 52 weeks.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Principles of Consolidation</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The consolidated
financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its wholly owned
subsidiaries, Overland Storage (Europe) Ltd., Overland Storage SARL, Overland
Storage GmbH, Tecmar, Inc., Okapi Acquisition Co., Inc. and Overland Storage
Export Limited, a foreign sales corporation.&#160;
All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been
eliminated.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management Estimates and
Assumptions</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The preparation of financial statements in conformity
with generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make
estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and
liabilities and disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of
the financial statements and reported amounts of revenues and expenses during
the reporting period.&#160; Actual results
could differ from those estimates.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Revenue Recognition</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue on direct product
sales (excluding sales to commercial distributors and certain OEM customers) is
recognized upon shipment of products to such customers. These customers are not
subject to any specific right of return or price protection, except for any
defective product which may be returned under the Company&#146;s warranty
policy.&#160; Title and risk of loss transfer
to the customer when the product leaves the Company&#146;s dock.&#160; Product sales to commercial distribution
customers are subject to certain rights of return, stock rotation privileges
and price protection.&#160; Revenue from
shipments to these customers is not recognized until the related products are
in turn sold by the commercial distributor.&#160;
At June&nbsp;30, 2004, $1,037,000 of product had been shipped to the
Company&#146;s commercial distributors, but not yet shipped to the distributors&#146;
customers.&#160; As part of its agreement with
certain OEM customers, the Company ships products to various distribution hubs
around the world and retains ownership of that inventory until it is pulled by
these OEM customers to fulfill their customer orders, at which time, generally
the same business day, the Overland sale is recorded.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has entered
into various licensing agreements relating to its Variable Rate Randomizer
(VR2) technology. &#160;These agreements
typically call for royalty fees based on sales by licensees of products
containing VR2. Royalties on sales by licensees of products containing VR2 are
recorded when earned, generally in the period during which the licensee ships
the products containing VR2 technology.&#160;
In certain instances, the customer has elected to purchase from the
Company the Applications Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) chips embodying
VR2, which are priced to include the cost of the chip plus an embedded royalty
fee.&#160; In these instances, revenues on
ASIC chip sales are recorded as product revenue when earned, which is upon the
shipment of the underlying ASIC chip incorporating the VR2 technology to the
customer.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In some cases, these
licensing agreements include initial payments to the Company for the delivery
of the VR<sup>2</sup> technology platform, consulting services or both.&#160; The Company recognizes revenues related to
the transfer of the technology platform upon delivery and acceptance by the
customer, which entitles the Company to the initial fee and eliminates any
further obligations under the agreement.&#160;
The Company recognizes revenue related to consulting services as earned,
typically based on time committed to the project.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Shipping and
Handling</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Amounts billed to
customers for shipping and handling are included in product sales and costs
incurred related to shipping and handling are included in cost of revenues.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Research and Development Costs</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Research and development
costs are expensed as incurred.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising Costs</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising costs are expensed as incurred.&#160; Advertising expenses for 2004, 2003 and 2002
were $1,730,000, $1,223,000 and $1,539,000, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>

<div align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Warranty Costs</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company generally provides a three-year advance
replacement return-to-factory warranty on its NEO SERIES, PowerLoader and
LoaderXpress products and a one year advance replacement return-to-factory
warranty on its REO SERIES.&#160; The Company
also provides on-site service for the first warranty year of the NEO SERIES
products for which it contracts with third-party service providers.&#160; For most products, the Company offers a
program called XchangeNOW as part of its return-to-factory warranty which
enables customers to receive an advance replacement unit shipped within two
business days after placing a service request.&#160;
The customer ships the defective unit back to the Company using the
shipping materials from the replacement unit. The Company records a provision
for estimated future warranty costs at the time of shipment for both the
return-to-factory and on-site warranties.&#160;
Separately priced on-site warranties are offered for sale to customers
of other product lines.&#160; The Company
contracts with outside vendors to provide service relating to all on-site
warranties.&#160; Warranty revenues and
amounts paid in advance to outside service organizations are recognized in the
financial statements in revenues and cost of revenues, respectively, over the warranty
period.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fair Value of
Financial Instruments</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s financial instruments consist of cash
and cash equivalents, investments in debt securities (Note 3), trade
receivables and payables and its revolving line of credit (Note 6).&#160; The carrying amounts of these instruments
approximate fair value because of their short-term maturities and variable
interest rates.&#160; Fair values of the
investments in debt securities are estimated based on quoted market prices for
these securities.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Comprehensive Income</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Comprehensive
income for the Company includes net income, foreign currency translation
adjustments and unrealized losses on available-for-sale securities, which are
charged or credited to accumulated other comprehensive income within
shareholders&#146; equity.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Segment
Data</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reports
segment data based on the management approach. The management approach
designates the internal reporting that is used by management for making
operating and investment decisions and evaluating performance as the source of
the Company&#146;s reportable segments.&#160; The
Company uses one measurement of profitability and does not disaggregate its
business for internal reporting.&#160; Based
on the criteria of SFAS No. 131, &#147;Disclosures about Segments of an Enterprise
and Related Information,&#148; the Company has determined that it operates in one
segment providing data storage solutions for mid-range computer networks.&#160; The Company discloses information about
products and services, geographic areas and major customers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Concentrations of
Risks</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s customers include original equipment manufacturers,
distributors, and value added resellers.&#160;
Financial instruments which potentially subject the Company to
concentrations of credit risk are primarily accounts receivable.&#160; The Company performs ongoing credit
evaluations of its customers, generally requires no collateral and maintains
allowances for potential credit losses and sales returns.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s largest single customer accounted for approximately 59%,
58% and 62% of sales in fiscal years 2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively, and
approximately 44%, 52% and 49% of accounts receivable at June&nbsp;30, 2004,
2003 and 2002, respectively. No other customer accounted for 10% or more of
sales in any of the three years presented.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information about
Geographic Areas</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company markets its
products domestically and internationally, with its principal international
market being Europe.&#160; The tables below
contain information about the geographical areas in which the Company operates.
Revenues are attributed to the location to which the product was shipped.&#160; Long-lived assets are based on location of
domicile.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue attributed to the
Netherlands and the United Kingdom was primarily the result of shipments to
Compaq/HP European distribution centers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.02%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="69%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:69.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.02%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="69%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:69.7%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.52%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.52%;">

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9,171</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.02%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash Equivalents</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Highly liquid investments
with original maturities of three months or less are classified as cash
equivalents.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Inventories</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories
are stated at the lower of cost (first-in-first-out method) or market.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and
Equipment</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and equipment
are recorded at cost.&#160; Depreciation is
computed using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the
depreciable assets as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:80.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Leasehold improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.18%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="47%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The shorter of
  the estimated useful lives of the assets or the term of the lease using the
  straight-line method</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Machinery and equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.18%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="47%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3-5 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="49%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.86%;">

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="47%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.86%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Computer equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.18%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="47%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3-5 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Expenditures for normal
maintenance and repair are charged to expense as incurred, and improvements are
capitalized.&#160; Upon the sale or retirement
of property or equipment, the asset cost and related accumulated depreciation
are removed from the respective accounts and any gain or loss is included in
the results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-Lived Assets</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:31.5pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company evaluates the recoverability of long-lived assets, including property
and equipment and certain identifiable intangible assets, in accordance with
SFAS 144, &#147;Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets,&#148;
which it adopted on July&nbsp;1, 2002. SFAS 144 requires the Company to review
for impairment of long-lived assets whenever events or changes in circumstances
indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Factors
considered important which could trigger an impairment review include: </font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:31.5pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>significant
underperformance relative to historical or projected future operating results;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>significant
changes in the manner of use of the assets or the strategy for our overall
business;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>significant
decrease in the market value of the assets; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>significant
negative industry or economic trends.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">When the Company determines that the carrying amount
of long-lived assets may not be recoverable based upon the existence of one or
more of the above indicators, it assesses the assets for impairment based on
the estimated future undiscounted cash flows expected to result from the use of
the asset and its eventual disposition. If the carrying amount of an asset
exceeds its estimated future undiscounted cash flows, an impairment loss is
recorded for the excess of the asset&#146;s carrying amount over its fair value.
Fair value is generally determined based on the estimated future discounted
cash flows over the remaining useful life of the asset using a discount rate
determined by management to be commensurate with the risk inherent in the
Company&#146;s current business model. The assumptions supporting the cash flows,
including the discount rates, are determined using management&#146;s best estimates
as of the date of the impairment review. If these estimates or their related
assumptions change in the future, the Company may be required to record
additional impairment charges for these assets and future results of operations
could be adversely affected.&#160; The Company
has not recorded any material impairment losses.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Foreign Currency Translation</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The financial statements of foreign subsidiaries, for
which the functional currency is the local currency, are translated into U.S.
dollars using the exchange rate at the balance sheet date for assets and
liabilities and the weighted average exchange rate during the year for
revenues, expenses, gains and losses.&#160;
Translation adjustments are recorded as accumulated other comprehensive
income within shareholders&#146; equity.&#160; Gains
or losses from foreign currency transactions are recognized currently in
income.&#160; Such transactions resulted in a
gain of $69,000, a loss of $338,000 and a gain of $29,000 for the years ended
June&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='42',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income Taxes</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company provides for
income taxes utilizing the liability method. Under the liability method, a
deferred tax asset and/or liability is computed for both the expected future
impact of differences between the financial statement and tax bases of assets
and liabilities, and for the expected future tax benefit to be derived from tax
credits and loss carryforwards.&#160; Current
income tax expense or benefit represents the amount of income taxes expected to
be payable or refundable for the current year.&#160;
A valuation allowance is established when, in the opinion of management,
it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets
will not be realized.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Net Income Per Share</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic earnings per share
is computed based on the weighted average number of shares of common stock
outstanding during the period.&#160; Diluted
earnings per share is computed based on the weighted average number of shares
of common stock outstanding during the period increased by the weighted average
number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding during the period,
using the treasury stock method.&#160;
Anti-dilutive common stock equivalents excluded from the computation of
diluted earnings per share amounted to 512,000, 6,000 and 194,000 in the fiscal
years ended June&nbsp;30, 2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A reconciliation of the
calculation of basic and diluted earnings per share is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:80.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="54%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:54.46%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="41%" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:41.7%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year Ended June&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.06%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="54%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:54.46%;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='43',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock-Based
Compensation</font></b></h4>

<h4 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company measures
compensation expense for its stock-based employee compensation plans using the
intrinsic value method and provides pro forma disclosures of net income and earnings
per share as if the fair value-based method had been applied in measuring
compensation expense.&#160; Compensation
charges related to non-employee stock-based compensation are measured using
fair value methods and recognized as earned.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for
employee stock-based compensation using the intrinsic value method.&#160; In most cases, no compensation expense has
been recognized for its employee stock option grants, as they have been granted
at the fair market value of the underlying Common Stock at the date of
grant.&#160; No compensation expense has been
recognized for purchase rights under the ESPP as they have been granted in
accordance with the terms of the ESPP.<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font></b>Had compensation expense for the
Company&#146;s employee stock-based compensation awards issued during 2004, 2003 and
2002 been determined based on a fair value method, the Company&#146;s net income and
net income per share would have been reduced to the pro forma amounts indicated
below:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:80.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="53%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:53.12%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="42%" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:42.94%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year Ended June&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="53%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:53.12%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.82%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.39</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.82%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.15</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.82%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.15</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of each option grant is estimated on
the date of grant using a Black-Scholes option-pricing model.&#160; The weighted-average estimated fair value of
employee stock options granted during fiscal years 2004, 2003 and 2002 were
$13.76, $13.41 and $6.42 per share, respectively.&#160; The weighted average assumptions used for
grants during the fiscal years 2004, 2003 and 2002 were: no dividend yield for
all years, risk-free interest rates of 4.2%, 3.7% and 4.8%, respectively,
expected volatility of 79%, 82% and 82%, respectively, and expected lives of
7.0 years for all fiscal years.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of each share purchase right under the ESPP is estimated
at the inception of each offering period also using a Black-Scholes
option-pricing model.&#160; The
weighted-average estimated fair value of each share purchase right granted
during fiscal years 2004, 2003 and 2002 was $4.71, $4.65 and $4.36 per share,
respectively.&#160; The weighted average
assumptions used during fiscal years 2004, 2003 and 2002 were: no dividend
yield for all years, risk-free interest rates of 3.7%, 3.7% and 4.8%,
respectively, expected volatility of 57%, 79% and 106%, respectively, and an
expected life of 6 months for all fiscal years.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 2 &#150; ACQUISITION OF CERTAIN
ASSETS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
June&nbsp;2003, the Company acquired all of the assets and assumed all of the
liabilities of Okapi Software, Inc., a privately held company based in San
Diego, California. This acquisition was accounted for as an asset acquisition
in accordance with SFAS 142, &#147;Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets.&#148; The
Company&#146;s consolidated statements of operations include the results of Okapi
from the date of acquisition.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Okapi
provided intelligent disk-based storage appliances used by Information
Technology managers to reduce their back up window, speed restores and
compliment tape back up strategies all while fitting within existing
infrastructure. Okapi&#146;s solution combines proprietary management software with
iSCSI and ATA disk technologies to create high-speed, scalable and reliable
disk-to-disk-to-tape solutions.&#160; Their
solution accelerates backup by 50 to 90%; restores data in milliseconds;
completes back up consistently and provides a quick, reliable replication of
critical data to secure, remote locations to eliminate the need to transport
magnetic tapes.&#160; Okapi&#146;s solution is an
adjacent appliance that fills a customer need and complements the Company&#146;s
existing family of tape automation products.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">The
aggregate purchase price for the assets of Okapi of $5,364,000 was comprised of
the issuance of 134,551 shares of Overland stock valued at $2,705,000, cash of
$2,500,000, and $159,000 of acquisition related costs. Of the $5,364,000
purchase price, $41,000 was allocated to the net tangible liabilities acquired
and $8,983,000, which includes a deferred tax liability, was allocated to
acquired technology.&#160; As this transaction
was accounted for as a tax-free exchange, the Company recorded a deferred tax
liability of $3,578,000.&#160; The acquired
technology represented by the intangible asset is amortized over a five year
life.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2004, the
Company was able to claim certain tax benefits related to the Okapi acquisition
on its fiscal year 2003 tax return that were not allocated at the time of the
purchase.&#160; As a result, in fiscal year
2004, the purchase price of the intangible asset was reduced by $263,000 to
reflect these tax benefits including a reduction of the related deferred tax
liability.&#160; The adjusted purchase price
of the intangible asset will be amortized over four years, the remaining useful
life of the asset.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">45</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At June&nbsp;30, 2004,
all of the Company&#146;s investments in marketable securities were classified as
available-for-sale, and as a result, are reported at fair value.&#160; Net unrealized losses on the Company&#146;s
marketable securities at June&nbsp;30, 2004 amounted to $33,000, net of
tax.&#160; Fair values of marketable
securities are estimated based on quoted market prices for these securities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the twelve months
ended June&nbsp;30, 2004 and 2003, the Company had no proceeds from the sale of
short-term investments and, therefore, has realized no gains or losses.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:31.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of June&nbsp;30, 2004,
$6,285,000 of the Company&#146;s short-term investments had underlying maturities of
between one and two years.&#160; The remaining
short-term investments as of June&nbsp;30, 2004 all had maturities of between
three and twelve months.&#160; As of
June&nbsp;30, 2003, the Company had no amounts held as short-term investments.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;text-indent:1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and amortization expense was $2,367,000,
$2,354,000 and $2,109,000 in fiscal years 2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 5 &#150; INTANGIBLE ASSETS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company had
intangible assets of $6,924,000 and $8,983,000 at June 30, 2004 and 2003,
respectively, consisting solely of the technology purchased in the Okapi
acquisition during fiscal year 2003 as discussed in Note 2.&#160; During fiscal year 2004, $1,796,000 was
amortized.&#160; During fiscal year 2003, no
amounts were amortized due to the timing of the acquisition near the end of the
fiscal year.&#160; The Okapi technology is
being amortized over five years.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Estimated amortization
expense for this intangible asset will be approximately $1.7&nbsp;million for
the twelve months ending June&nbsp;30, 2005 and each of the three fiscal years
thereafter.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 6 - LONG-TERM DEBT</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At June 30, 2004,
the Company had a credit facility consisting of a $10,000,000 revolving line of
credit for working capital purposes that expires on November 30, 2004.&#160; The line of credit is collateralized by
substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets.&#160;
Interest on the line of credit is set at the bank&#146;s prime rate (4.0% on
June 30, 2004) in effect from time to time minus 0.25% or, at the Company&#146;s
option, a rate equal to LIBOR plus 2.25%.&#160;
The loan agreement that governs the credit facility contains certain
financial and non-financial covenants.&#160;
At June 30, 2004, no amounts were outstanding under the line of
credit.&#160; In December 2003, the Company
extinguished the outstanding term note balance of $3,724,000.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A reconciliation of income taxes computed by applying
the federal statutory income tax rate of 34%<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">  </font></b>to
income before income taxes to the total income tax provision reported in the
Consolidated Statement of Operations is as follows:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">

  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="56%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:56.66%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provision
  for income taxes</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">77</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">260</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No valuation
allowance was recorded as of June&nbsp;30, 2004 or 2003, as the Company
believes it is more likely than not the deferred tax assets will be realized.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTE
8 - COMMON STOCK</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;11, 2004,
the Board of Directors authorized the purchase of up to $10,000,000 of the
Company&#146;s common stock on the open market or through negotiated transactions.
This repurchase authority allows the Company, at management&#146;s discretion, to
selectively repurchase its common stock from time to time in the open market or
in privately negotiated transactions depending on market price and other
factors. The share repurchase authorization has no stated expiration date.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">On May
15, 2003, the Company sold 1,430,000 shares of common stock in a private
placement transaction.&#160; The stock was
sold at $15.39, a 10 percent discount to the closing market price on May 12,
2003. Gross proceeds to Overland were $22,008,000 with net proceeds after
commission and offering expenses of $20,623,000. Proceeds will be used by the
Company to fund working capital needs in support of the growth of its business
and for general corporate purposes.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTE
9 - STOCK OPTIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has seven active stock option plans, administered by the
Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors, which provide for the
issuance of options to employees, officers, directors and consultants.&#160; As of June&nbsp;30, 2004, the Company had
reserved 5,174,990 shares of common stock for issuance under the 1991
Non-Qualified Stock Option Plan (1991 Plan), 1993 Stock Option Plan, 1993-A
Stock Option Plan, 1995 Stock Option Plan, 1997 Executive Stock Option Plan,
2000 Stock Option Plan, 2001 Supplemental Stock Option Plan (2001 Plan), and
the 2003 Equity Incentive Plan (2003 Plan) (collectively, the Option
Plans).&#160; The Option Plans provide for the
granting of stock options equal to the fair market value of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock on the date the option is granted.&#160;
The Option Plans have been approved by shareholders with the exception
of the 1991 Plan and the 2001 Plan.&#160;
Currently, the Company may grant options only from the 2003 Plan.&#160; Certain options issued under selected plans
call for 100% vesting of outstanding options upon a change of control of the
Company or upon death or disability of the optionee.&#160; Options granted during the last three fiscal
years generally vest over a three year period, with monthly vesting from the
date of grant.&#160; Options granted in prior
years generally vested at a rate of 25% per year over a four-year period from
the date of grant.&#160; Options expire after
a period not to exceed ten years, except in the event of termination, whereupon
vested shares must be exercised generally within</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>


<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='49',FILE='C:\JMS\eudelhofen\04-10378-1\task183368\10378-1-bc.htm',USER='eudelho',CD='Sep 10 13:15 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">three months under
the 2003 Plan and within 30 days under the other Option Plans, or upon death or
disability, where an extended six or twelve-month exercise period is
specified.&#160; As of June&nbsp;30, 2004,
approximately 2.8 million shares were reserved for issuance upon exercise of
outstanding options and approximately 220,000 were available for grant under
the Option Plans.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Option activity for the three years ended June&nbsp;30, 2004 is
summarized as follows:</font></p>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.78%;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p>
